metadata.title: CVE-2023-0266 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A use after free vulnerability exists in the ALSA PCM package in the LinuxKernel. SNDRV_CTL_IOCTL_ELEM_{READ|WRITE}32 is missing locks that can beused in a use-after-free that can result in a priviledge escalation to gainring0 access from the system user. We recommend upgrading past commit56b88b50565cd8b946a2d00b0c83927b7ebb055e

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
